means: 心不在焉的，茫然的，恍惚的

sentence.Network_en: Occasionally he was even rather absentminded and faraway when the bride leaned forward and addressed him.
sentence.Network_cn: 偶尔,当新娘探身对他说话时,他甚至有点心不在焉和精神恍惚.

sentence.Network_en: Between the talk, we have kind of absentminded feeling.
sentence.Network_cn: 谈话间, 我们都有种恍惚之感.

sentence.Network_en: Michael looked at her in an absentminded fashion.
sentence.Network_cn: 迈克尔望着她,表现出心不在焉的样子.

英语同义词_徒工_新浪博客 ... mimic 模仿,模拟 absentminded 心不在焉的,茫然的 distrait 心不在焉的.

the Jing in his heart is colourful , can't help expression is absentminded rise , staring at beautiful girl to look merely , forgot even wine how to be drunk .他心里惊艳，不由得神情恍惚起来，只顾盯着丽姑娘看，连酒都忘记怎么喝了。
absentminded unease , I stroll to the window ., 怀着茫然的不安 , 我信步走到窗前.

entry.tran: 漫不经心的;心不在焉的;健忘的
entry.def: Someone who is absent-minded forgets things or does not pay attention to what they are doing, often because they are thinking about something else.

example.ex: In his later life he became even more absent-minded.
example.tran: 他晚年变得愈加健忘了。

sentences.sentence: "the scatty glancing quality of a hyperactive but unfocused intelligence"
